intro: Sphacele calycina var. wallacei, commonly known as the Wallace's spurge, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant features simple, alternate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are small and clustered in cyathia, typical of the Euphorbiaceae family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical forests.
